Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is growing well with enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant that is not growing well because it does not have enough water.
The student can draw a plant that is not growing well because it does not have enough light.
The student can use their drawings to show how plants need water to live and grow.
The student can use their drawings to show how plants need light to live and grow.
The student can identify the differences between healthy plants and plants lacking water or light in their drawings.
